HowToUse_diacritics_content.message: Some languages require letters with diacritics (e.g. é, è, ë). These characters can be typed in two ways:[list][*]Find the required character on the keyboard corresponding to the language you are studying. The cheatsheet can assist you. [br][b]Note:[/b]  Sometimes you need to use [Shift] and/or [AltGr] (the [Alt] button right of the [Spacebar]) to get access to these characters.[*]If you prefer a more generic approach or if there are too many diacritics required in a language, use the so called "Dead keys". "Dead keys" are characters that do not produce output directly. They are stored in memory and produce output depending on your next keypress. For example after pressing the "Dead key" [ " ] and then pressing [e] gives ë. If you want the " character you need to hit space after pressing the "Dead key". [br][b]Note:[/b] "Dead key" characters are red on the cheatsheet.[/list][img=../img/KeyboardExplanation.jpg]Example of special characters accessed by pressing [AltGr] and "Dead Keys" displayed in red.[/img]

HowToUse_getting_started_content.message: Thank you for using DuoKeyboard! If you just installed DuoKeyboard and the [url=page://home]settings page[/url] does not show you any settings, just start a lesson on [url=https://duolingo.com]duolingo.com[/url]. When you encounter a question during a duolingo.com lesson where you have to provide keyboard input, DuoKeyboard will ask you what to do like shown in the figure below:[img=../img/DuoKeyboardConfig.jpg]Example of the DuoKeyboard configuration options during a lesson. The select box for the available keyboards is encircled.[/img] After configuring your setup and saving the settings DuoKeyboard will automatically change your keyboard when necessary. Your settings page will no longer be limited. From now on you can use the [url=page://home]settings page[/url] to change your settings.[img=../img/DuoKeyboardAuto.jpg]After configuring DuoKeyboard a keyboard will, depending on your configurations, appear underneath the question.[/img][b]Note:[/b] During some questions the input field at [url=https://duolingo.com]duolingo.com[/url] does not provide information on which language to use for the input. In such cases a DuoKeyboard button will appear underneath the input field. Clicking on the button will allow you to change your keyboard to any language needed. When you have a configuration saved a quick select options will also appear. [img=../img/DuoKeyboardManual.jpg]Example of manual keyboard select. Please note the small DuoKeyboard button underneath the input field and the quick select option (only available after saving a configuration).[/img]

HowToUse_ime_content.message: Some languages use complex and/or so many characters that a generic keyboard cannot incorporate them all. To be able to type these characters the "[b]input method extension[/b]" can be used. DuoKeyboard supports Vietnamese characters using TELEX, VNI and VIQR input and Korean Revised Romanization input. [br][b]Note:[/b] The "[b]input method extension[/b]" can be combined with different keyboard layouts.

HowToUse_korean_consonent_table_caption.message: Typing consonents using the Korean Revised Rominization

HowToUse_korean_content.message: Here only a brief description is given of how to type Korean with DuoKeyboard. If you do not know how to type Korean at all please look elsewhere. Korean can be typed using either a Korean keyboard or by using the Korean Revised Romanization "[b]input method extension[/b]". In both cases characters can be constructed by first typing a consonant followed by a vowel and an optional consonant. Using a keyboard layout is pretty straight forward. When using the "[b]input method extension[/b]" the following combinations produce the following characters:

HowToUse_korean_vowel_table_caption.message: Typing vowels using the Korean Revised Rominization.

HowToUse_vietnamese_content.message: In the Vietnamese language diacritics have to be added to certain characters (e.g.: a, d, e, i, o, u and y). By using one of the three different "[b]input method extensions[/b]" you can easily add these diacritic characters to the letters. The required diacritics can be added by first typing the normal letter (e.g.: a, e, i, o) and then a special additional character. This is comprehended in the following table:

HowToUse_vietnamese_system_table_caption.message: Typing different Vietnamese diacritics using various writing systems.

Options_settings_save_message.message: The settings have been saved. You may have to reload duolingo.com to apply the changes.

Options_settings_starter_info.message: Thank you for using DuoKeyboard! Currently, there are no settings available. Just start a lesson on [url=https://duolingo.com]duolingo.com[/url]. When you encounter a question during the lesson where you have to provide keyboard input, DuoKeyboard will ask you how it should be configured. [u]After[/u] selecting and saving the configurations you can edited them here at this settings page. If you want to know more about the workings of DuoKeyboard you can read more about it in  [url=page://how_to_use]how to use[/url].
